docs.snippet: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, March 20 (AP) -- Val Ziegenfuss of San Diego and Linda Tuero of Metairie, La., won singles matches today as the United States beat Rhodesia in the first round of the women's Federation Cup international tennis tournament.
docs.lead_paragraph: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, March 20 (AP) -- Val Ziegenfuss of San Diego and Linda Tuero of Metairie, La., won singles matches today as the United States beat Rhodesia in the first round of the women's Federation Cup international tennis tournament.

headline.main: U.S. WOMEN SCORE IN FEDERATION CUP; Capture 2 Singles Matches From Rhodesia -- Britain, France Also Advance

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, March 21 -- A wave of political assassinations and kidnappings sweeping Argentina is regarded as a serious challenge to plans to hold elections for a constitutional government.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, March 21 -- A wave of political assassinations and kidnappings sweeping Argentina is regarded as a serious challenge to plans to hold elections for a constitutional government.
docs.abstract: Argentine industrialist O Sallustro seized, Buenos Aires, by urban guerrillas in police uniforms; seizure continues campaign by extremists who in past wk have assassinated prominent conservative politician P A Agarotti and kidnapped wine co exec P Donati; Donati was released after payment of $37,000 ransom; actions present security challenge to Lanusse Govt and appear to be in defiance of order from J D Peron, who has called on Peronist commando groups to halt terrorism; pol party leader M R Uzal assassinated by Peronist group known as Montoneros, who broke into his home

headline.main: Industrialist Seized As Terrorist Wave Sweeps Argentina

byline.original: By JUAN de ONISSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, March 21 (Reuters) -- Australia, the United States and France advanced to the third round of the Federation Cup women's team tennis tournament today.
docs.lead_paragraph: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, March 21 (Reuters) -- Australia, the United States and France advanced to the third round of the Federation Cup women's team tennis tournament today.

headline.main: U.S. Advances With Australia And France in Federation Cup

docs.snippet: SAN SALVADOR, March 27 (UPI) -- Several leaders of the unsuccessful uprising against the Government Saturday were reported hiding in foreign embassies here today.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN SALVADOR, March 27 (UPI) -- Several leaders of the unsuccessful uprising against the Government Saturday were reported hiding in foreign embassies here today.
docs.abstract: San Salvador orphanage accidentally bombed when Salvadoran Air Force planes strafed rebel mil barracks; illus; some of children and staff killed

headline.main: Leaders of Uprising in Salvador Reported in Hiding in Embassies

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., April 2--At a time when a number of cases involving the death penalty are pending in the United States Supreme Court, a United Nations inquiry shows that many governments still are reluctant to abolish capital punishment.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., April 2--At a time when a number of cases involving the death penalty are pending in the United States Supreme Court, a United Nations inquiry shows that many governments still are reluctant to abolish capital punishment.
docs.abstract: UN inquiry into death penalty shows that many govts are still reluctant to abolish capital punishment; replies from 69 countries show 75% still use death penalty, although fewer people are sentenced to death and even fewer executed; study's findings detailed

headline.main: NATIONS HOLDING TO DEATH PENALTY; U.N. Study Shows Abolition Movement Is Faltering

byline.original: By KATHLEEN TELTSCHSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, April 4 -- The Presidents of Brazil and Bolivia met today on the border between their two countries and signed agreements that gave formal shape to Brazil's seven-month-old program to aid her small neighbor.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, April 4 -- The Presidents of Brazil and Bolivia met today on the border between their two countries and signed agreements that gave formal shape to Brazil's seven-month-old program to aid her small neighbor.
docs.abstract: Brazil agrees, Apr 5, to purchase Bolivian oil from Santa Cruz fields for 2-yr period beginning July, '72

headline.main: Brazil and Bolivia Sign Pacts Making Aid Formal

byline.original: By JOSEPH NOVITSKISpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON -- Richard Nixon is not the only American statesman awaited next month by Leonid Brezhnev, the Soviet boss, for, after eight years' absence, Fidel Castro, still sputtering visions of Latin revolution, also intends to visit Moscow in May.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON -- Richard Nixon is not the only American statesman awaited next month by Leonid Brezhnev, the Soviet boss, for, after eight years' absence, Fidel Castro, still sputtering visions of Latin revolution, also intends to visit Moscow in May.
docs.abstract: C L Sulzberger, discussing Cuban Premier Castro visit to Moscow in May, notes proximity in time to Nixon's visit

headline.main: And at My Back I Always Hear...

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO -- From a small river city in the middle of South America, Brazil last week announced to the world at large and to South America in particular that she was in the foreign aid business as a donor and Bolivia was her largest client.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO -- From a small river city in the middle of South America, Brazil last week announced to the world at large and to South America in particular that she was in the foreign aid business as a donor and Bolivia was her largest client.
docs.abstract: comment on recent announcement by Brazilian Govt that it is aiding Latin Amer nations, with Bolivia as its largest client; Bolivian Pres Banzer and Brazilian Pres Medici illus signing aid agreement; map showing amt recd by neighboring countries from Brazil

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 12 (AP) -- Fifteen Tupamaro guerrillas and 10 other prisoners escaped today from the Punta Carretas Penitentiary through a tunnel more than 200 feet long extending from the prison hospital to a sewer outside the prison...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 12 (AP) -- Fifteen Tupamaro guerrillas and 10 other prisoners escaped today from the Punta Carretas Penitentiary through a tunnel more than 200 feet long extending from the prison hospital to a sewer outside the prison wall.
docs.abstract: 15 Tupamaro guerrillas and 10 other prisoners escape from Punta Carretas Penitentiary through tunnel extending from prison hosp to sewer outside prison wall; escapees include 7 major guerrilla leaders who had been recaptured after 106 Tupamaros escaped from prison last Sept 6; Pres Bordaberry calls meeting with Govt leaders

headline.main: 15 Tupamaro Guerrillas Flee Prison in Montevideo

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 14 (AP) -- Leftist Tupamaro guerrillas struck in a series of fatal ambushes around Montevideo today, touching off citywide warfare with Government forces. Four officials and eight Tupamaros were reported killed.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 14 (AP) -- Leftist Tupamaro guerrillas struck in a series of fatal ambushes around Montevideo today, touching off citywide warfare with Government forces. Four officials and eight Tupamaros were reported killed.
docs.abstract: Tupamaros strike in series of fatal ambushes around Montevideo, touching off city-wide warfare with Uruguayan Govt forces; 4 officials and 8 guerrillas reptd killed; Pres Bordaberry asks Cong to convene in emergency session and to declare state of internal war

headline.main: ' War' Proclaimed In Uruguay as 12 Die in Rebel Action
